New Records: Akeal Hosein set a new personal high score in T20Is with 44 runs
Romario Shepherd also set a new personal high score in T20Is with 44 runs
The unbroken 72-run ninth-wicket partnership set a record for a game involving a full ICC member
Key Match Events: England bounced back from their opening T20I loss to level the series 1-1
Jason Roy caned Fabian Allen for 24 runs in the 11th over
West Indies lost wickets in clusters but the way Akeal Hosein and Romario Shepherd fought at the back end
Akeal Hosein hit three sixes and two fours in the final over to nearly pull off an unlikely win for West Indies
Pre-Game Insights: No pre-match insights were provided in the article
Post-Match Reflections: Kieron Pollard expressed pride in the way West Indies fought at the back end
Eoin Morgan was delighted with the tight game and the team's performance in death hitting and death bowling
Miscellaneous Highlights: The teams have two days off before they return to Kensington Oval for the next match
Others: The match was played at Kensington Oval in Bridgetown, Barbados
Reece Topley played his first T20I since the 2016 World Cup
